column1: - Carotid duplex ultrasound looks at the carotid artery in the neck.
- Duplex ultrasound of the extremities looks at the arms or legs.
You will need to wear blood pressure cuffs on your arms and legs for this test.
The ABI number is obtained by dividing the blood pressure in the ankle by the blood pressure in the arm.
Tell the person doing the ultrasound exam if you are taking any medicines, such as blood thinners.
An abnormal result may be due to a blood clot or plaque buildup in a blood vessel.
